column2: Identification of ORD tools and workflows for publication of FAIR qualitative data in Td research
column3: Activity 1.1: Literature review on existing practices of FAIR and open data for Td and qualitative research
column4: RQ 1.1: What procedures are currently used by researchers and practitioners to collect qualitative data in transdisciplinary settings? How do they assure FAIR principles?

column2: Identification of ORD tools and workflows for publication of FAIR qualitative data in Td research
column3: Activity 1.2: Identification of tools for the collection of and transcription of data
column4: RQ 1.2: What are best practice workflows for data management in order to share qualitative data?

column2: Identification of ORD tools and workflows for publication of FAIR qualitative data in Td research
column3: Activity 1.3: Development of workflows for transformation of text files in different formats to machine-readable table format
column4: RQ 1.3: What kinds of possibilities exist for collecting and sharing data from transdisciplinary methods using qualitative techniques, which might include workshops using flip chart drawings, post-it notes, group conversations, marked up maps, and other mixed media?

column2: Evaluation of current data practices and identification of training and education needs
column3: Activity 2.1: Ethics application explaining the unique character of our study.
column4: RQ 2.1: Under what conditions does sharing of qualitative data generated during Td research provide benefits for a) research participants, b) the Td project itself, or c) the Td community?

column2: Evaluation of current data practices and identification of training and education needs
column3: Activity 2.2: Workshop at the ITD Conference 2024 to identify and systematize  diverse perspectives on the topic
column4: RQ 2.2: What are the risks of sharing Td data openly to the groups listed above (RQ 2.1)? How can these be mitigated?

column2: Evaluation of current data practices and identification of training and education needs
column3: Activity 2.3: Identification and recruitment of interview respondents. Conduct interviews (in-person or via zoom) with 10 to 20 respondents
column4: RQ 2.3: If qualitative data is shared, what are potential formats for sharing this data to make it not only available to researchers but also to societal actors?

column2: Evaluation of current data practices and identification of training and education needs
column3: Activity 2.4: Transcription and conversion of interview audio files
column4: RQ 2.4: What kinds of concerns or benefits are specific to particular kinds of data? In other words, how is interview data different from workshop data? How might multia-media data be shared?

column2: Evaluation of current data practices and identification of training and education needs
column3: Activity 2.5: Qualitative coding and analysis of interview data

column2: Evaluation of current data practices and identification of training and education needs
column3: Activity 2.6: Transformation of interview data to ORD using workflows defined in WP1

column2: Development of guidelines and protocols for FAIR qualitative data in Td research
column3: Activity 3.1: Development of conditions for when sharing of qualitative data from Td processes is valuable, or when it should be avoided
column4: RQ 3.1: What are best practices in qualitative data sharing in Td research?

column2: Development of guidelines and protocols for FAIR qualitative data in Td research
column3: Activity 3.2: Development of technical protocols for how to share specific types of data (interview transcripts, workshop findings, multimedia)
column4: RQ 3.2: What are the technical protocols needed for sharing different kinds of qualitative data according to FAIR standards?

column2: Development of guidelines and protocols for FAIR qualitative data in Td research
column3: Activity 3.3: Create example data sharing website using the data generated in our project.
column4: RQ 3.3: What are the needs of researchers to make these practices actionable in Td settings?

column2: Development of guidelines and protocols for FAIR qualitative data in Td research
column3: Activity 3.4: 1 day in-person workshop at ETH to develop fully usable guidelines

column2: Building a community of practice for FAIR qualitative data in Td research
column3: Activity 4.1: Interactive webinar to share our results and dialogue with Td community

column2: Building a community of practice for FAIR qualitative data in Td research
column3: Activity 4.2: Sharing of website as a demo project, with data collected from our project displayed in engaging formats

column2: Building a community of practice for FAIR qualitative data in Td research
column3: Activity 4.3: Publication of scientific article describing our project and results in a widely read Td or qualitative journal

column2: Building a community of practice for FAIR qualitative data in Td research
column3: Activity 4.4:  Develop protocols suitable to be shared online in on-going Td toolkitsonline (such as ShapeID, TdNet toolbox).

column2: Building a community of practice for FAIR qualitative data in Td research
column3: Activity 4.5: Presentation of FAIRQual guidelines and protocols at Td and qualitative conferences by members of the TdLab
